eventName: Come Catastrophes or Wakes of Vultures
storyInfo: The water pipes inside the diner burst, causing serious property damage. However, Helena's insurance claim application is rejected by the bank, so Jessica steps in to help. In the evening, everyone gathers around the dinner table to reminisce about the good old days.

attributes.content: I feel weird saying this, but if the heating's still chugging along and the stove's lit too, why does it feel so cold? The bank's not up to something again, are they?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: I hung them up all night and my socks still ain't dry.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Hm? What's that noise?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: How many times do I have to tell you to shave, Woody? Every time you take a sip of water, you spill droplets all over the table.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: What are you on about? I ain't had a drink since I came in.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Then where did all these water stains come from?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Your diner's just getting old and rickety. Just like my brain these days...
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Like, am I remembering this wrong, or has there always been a huge water stain over there?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: The pipes— The water pipes ruptured?!
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Oh my god... No way my run-down old floorboards can handle all this water damage!
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Go and turn off the valve, then look for something to catch the water leaking in. I'll take care of things upstairs!
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: My poor waist... I can barely even stand up straight. How're things looking up there, Woody?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: I suggest you grab a chair and sit down before I tell you. You ain't as spry as you used to be.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Spare me the theatrics and just lay it on me. I've seen it all by now.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: It's flooded up to my knees, and all the furniture's ruined.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: ...What about my clothes in the wardrobe? Are they okay?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Your favorite color is red, right?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I hope this is good news...?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Mm, perfect. The water from the pipe's all rust-colored, so I'm guessing all your clothes will be, too.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: ...So, what the hell were you doing up there all this time?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Grabbing all this.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Oh... I almost forgot about this box. Where'd you find it?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Where else? In the wardrobe. Not like you have anywhere else to hide stuff. I also grabbed a few things off your nightstand.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: *sigh*... At least there's no water inside. Now let's take a look...
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: ...Here's the insurance policy. Should cover today's damages. Also the deed to the land, the house, and... my passbook.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Why're you still hanging onto that? You know you'll never touch none of that money.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Would you throw it away, if you were me?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: See, you get what I'm talking about, don't you? What he saved up all these years wasn't just the money. It was his conviction too.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Tch. Sentimental old fool.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: We're all old fools here, Woody. Compared to the fickle future, the pieces of the past we've built up over the years hit that much closer to home.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Says you.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: ...Look, it's the novel that was sitting on the nightstand, too. Ain't been opened for the longest time.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: The same old clichéd love story about a rich girl and some farmer.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Why you gotta be so grumpy? Ain't got nothing nice to say?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: I've got plenty. Like, good luck at the bank tomorrow.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: ...You should thank your lucky stars I've mellowed with age. So, what about you? Any plans for tomorrow?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: I'm gonna bring Jessica along to have a talk with someone.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: A talk?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Yup, just your normal talk.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: P-Put the gun down, yeah? If you've got something to say, old man, I'm listening.
attributes.name: Boorish Brute

attributes.content: What're you so scared of? If you ask me, I'm as gentle as they come.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: So, you wanna chat? Let's chat. You and the bandits out there have been meeting up in secret these last few days. How about you share what you talked about?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Let go of me, old man! I said... I said...
attributes.name: Boorish Brute

attributes.content: You spineless wimp!
attributes.name: Rude Ruffian

attributes.content: Give him a good kick, Jessica.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Umm, okay...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: What are you doing? Wiping your shoes on my pants?
attributes.name: Rude Ruffian

attributes.content: ...Forget it, Jessica. How's your aim?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: N-Not too bad, I think.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Perfect. Can you thread a bullet right between his ears?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Aaaaaargh!
attributes.name: Rude Ruffian

attributes.content: S-Sorry, sir, my hand is... still a bit shaky. But it's not like I hit you with that last one, so you can stop screaming.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: It's fine. You'll get it after a few tries.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: A-Alright!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: It... It was...
attributes.name: Rude Ruffian

attributes.content: It was what?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: It was because they've been short on manpower these days, so they're trying to recruit us. I figured, seeing how none of us on the plate can repay our debts anyway, might as well give some folks a chance to dig themselves out.
attributes.name: Rude Ruffian

attributes.content: You're talking about converting people to a life of banditry?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: It's.. It's not like I forced them or anything. They were ready to jump ship before I even finished talking.
attributes.name: Rude Ruffian

attributes.content: C'mon, like I said, what are you fellas so afraid of? Just tell me the truth.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: ...Says the man waving a gun in my face. What if we say something that pisses you off?
attributes.name: Rude Ruffian

attributes.content: Where are those bandits hiding now?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: H-How would I know? They're so damn slippery...
attributes.name: Rude Ruffian

attributes.content: That's enough, Jessica.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Just let us go already, old man. You can take anything you want from this room, please...
attributes.name: Boorish Brute

attributes.content: Color me surprised. These punks actually have some pretty nice stuff. Even got some bottles of beer and champagne in the corner.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Did we seriously just... let them walk away scot-free?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: All I care about is finding those missing people. If these punks wanna leave the plate, that's their call. I'm ain't gonna judge them for it.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: But, I think...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Want something to drink?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I think I'll pass.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: ...Hm. Mellow, full-bodied fragrance of hops, and a refreshing aftertaste... Where the hell did they get such quality booze?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: My sincerest apologies, Helena, ma'am. After a preliminary review and discussion, we cannot accept your compensation application. The damage to the water pipes in your incident photos is clearly manmade.
attributes.name: Bank Employee

attributes.content: Manmade? Wait... You mean, someone's messing with us again?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Considering your restaurant's revenue and liabilities, we have ample reason to believe that you deliberately damaged your own water system to cash out on the insurance plan.
attributes.name: Bank Employee

attributes.content: ...You think this is insurance fraud?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: No, ma'am, we're simply saying it's a reasonable conclusion to make. As long as you can provide professional proof that eliminates that possibility, we'll be able to move on to the claims process.
attributes.name: Bank Employee

attributes.content: How the hell am I supposed to find a judge or a lawyer on this damn plate?! It's been ages since they all left!
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: My apologies, but we're simply following procedure. If that's all, then I'd like to assist the next customer. There's a long line behind you.
attributes.name: Bank Employee

attributes.content: Then... Withdraw the money from this passbook.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: This passbook... Yes, this jogs my memory. You've already applied several times before, but can you prove that you came by this source of income legally?
attributes.name: Bank Employee

attributes.content: He sent me this passbook along with a letter, but by the time I arrived in Davistown, he'd already passed away! All his neighbors can attest to that!
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Do you really expect that to hold up, legally speaking?
attributes.name: Bank Employee

attributes.content: ...Just gimme back my stuff. I'm leaving.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: All your belongings are right here. Remember to take them with you, ma'am. Also, may I offer you a little reminder?
attributes.name: Bank Employee

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Based on the photos you provided, we can only guarantee one thing: the flooding to your restaurant has significantly reduced its value. Meaning it is no longer enough to offset your existing debts.
attributes.name: Bank Employee

attributes.content: If you don't want to enter the compulsory liquidation process, I recommend you consider the following—
attributes.name: Bank Employee

attributes.content: I've heard enough... Just keep your trap shut, bastard.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Helena?
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: Looks like she didn't notice us.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Why are there so many people here today? What's the bank up to?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: This is the collection notice I received earlier this morning. It says that I'm insolvent and will be declared bankrupt soon, but I've been making my payments...
attributes.name: Anxious Elderly Woman

attributes.content: Ma'am, we've been extending your loan term so far, but we're no longer able to grant you leniency.
attributes.name: Bank Employee

attributes.content: The good news is that after liquidating your existing assets, your remaining balance will be only two thousand gold certificates. Which I'm sure you'll have no trouble procuring?
attributes.name: Bank Employee

attributes.content: Please, can you extend it just another two months? No, one month is enough.
attributes.name: Anxious Elderly Woman

attributes.content: Unfortunately, no. We can't push it back even a single day.
attributes.name: Bank Employee

attributes.content: If you're unable to make your payment, we'll have no choice but to begin the compulsory process.
attributes.name: Bank Employee

attributes.content: All your property will be confiscated, and you'll have to leave Davistown within the time allotted. While continuing to pay your debt of roughly ten thousand certs, of course. Failure to do so will result in criminal liability.
attributes.name: Bank Employee

attributes.content: But I can't afford that! Whether it's two or ten thousand! Please, I beg you, just one more month's grace!
attributes.name: Anxious Elderly Woman

attributes.content: If you truly have no other options, then please take a look at this.
attributes.name: Bank Employee

attributes.content: ...The Pioneer Plan. If you apply now, you'll be able to enjoy a certain amount of loan forgiveness.
attributes.name: Bank Employee

attributes.content: But I'm already so old. Even if I went out the frontier, what could I possibly do?
attributes.name: Anxious Elderly Woman

attributes.content: Are you in any position to worry about that?
attributes.name: Bank Employee

attributes.content: Will you continue to carry your debt at the risk of criminal liability and lose the roof over your head, or would you rather shed some of your debt and start a new life on the frontier? ...Do you really need to hear my opinion?
attributes.name: Bank Employee

attributes.content: I'll sign it.
attributes.name: Anxious Elderly Woman

attributes.content: Excellent. Please head to your right. My colleagues there will help you get signed up.
attributes.name: Bank Employee

attributes.content: Next customer!
attributes.name: Bank Employee

attributes.content: What... What the hell is this...
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: If you two are here to discuss business, please get in line—
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: Oh, if it isn't Miss Liskarm and Miss Franka. How are you doing? Have you finished looking over the list?
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: You've got some explaining to do! Why are you forcing people out into the barrens?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: By signing the agreement, they can shed a lot of their existing debt and start over without that weight on their backs. Isn't that the best possible outcome?
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: ...And what about the list? How are any of these people supposed to be bandits? They're just a bunch of destitute old folks who don't want to be run out of their homes!
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Once they go bankrupt, their houses no longer belong to them, but rather to us, the creditors. What else would you call it when someone takes advantage of the lack of police to squat on someone else's property? Is that not a crime?
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: So your so-called 'law and order' is just driving out poor people who can't pay up?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: There's nothing 'so-called' about it. That is law and order, Miss Franka.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: Insurance fraud?! ...They're declaring you bankrupt?!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: That's why I didn't wanna talk about it. I feel like I'm gonna pop a blood vessel.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: If the bank is purposely depreciating the value of the diner, how much are they slashing it by?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I've been going back and forth with them for a while now, but seems like they're settling at fifty thousand certs.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: If it's only fifty thousand, I can... lend you the rest.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Just like you secretly 'lent' money to Leone?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Sylvia told you?!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: It's been eating her up inside, so she told me this morning. Don't worry though, I can keep a secret.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: If you want to lend me money, of course I'd accept it. But who knows how long it'll take to pay it back, if ever.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: I don't mind, even if you never pay it back.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: No, stop it... Don't say things like that. I'll definitely find a way to return the favor someday.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Here. When the bank comes to collect, give them this check. Sorry...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: *sigh*... And why are you apologizing? It ain't like you're the one borrowing money.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: By the way, one other thing. Leone was too embarrassed to tell you himself, but he wanted me to pass this on.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: He found out about the money?!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: You silly girl... I told you, your secret's safe with me. Why would I tell him? He just wants to treat you to a meal.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Seems like bandits ain't the only thing Woodrow's been tracking. He's got a good catch of fowlbeasts. Miles and Benny'll be there too.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Oh, okay then...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: You don't sound too happy about it.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: That's because... Actually, I saw a lot of people outside the bank on my way here. They were signing agreements... to head out to the frontier.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I asked around, and it seems like it's a way of shedding some of their debt.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: But why do they have to abandon everything and risk their lives to start over in a place with nothing, just for a little bit of debt relief?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Can they... even survive that ordeal?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: And last but not least, the main course. Garlic-crusted fowlbeast with roast potatoes.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Whoa, that smells amazing...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I'll have this piece.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Put it down, Woody. That's for Jessica.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: You heard her. She's the star of tonight's feast.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: It's no big deal. I just saw what was going on in Davistown and felt that I couldn't sit back and watch... As for the food, I'm fine with whatever, really. I even had some biscuits earlier, so I'm not that hungry.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: See, she's fine with it.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: No means no. Benny, this one's for you.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Oh, wow... Th-Thank you very much.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Tch...
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: What's so funny?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: N-Nothing. It just occurred to me how different you seem, compared to when we first met.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Yeah... He's been like that for ages. When he first strolled in town, he immediately pissed off pretty much everyone in the mines. We all thought that this grumpy, sharp-tongued asshole was here to cause trouble.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: And what happened after that?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Then, he met Helena.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: He really should be thanking her. If it weren't for her warmth and willingness to put in a few good words for him with those unlikable fellas...
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: But chat a bit today, and you'll find common ground tomorrow. In the end, she discovered his more... charming side, and showed it off to the others.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: There was even a song going around at that time, probably written by one of her admirers. Still remember how it goes, Miles?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Oh yeah, I almost forgot... Right, there was that song. I think it's coming back to me.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: Give us the intro, and let's sing it together—
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Who gave you jerks permission to sing in my restaurant—
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: ♪I wandered here alone, not a penny to my name♪
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: ♪My hometown far behind me, miles and miles away♪
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: ♪The barrens stretch before me, as far as I can see♪
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: ♪And who's waiting at the end, who indeed but she♪
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: ♪She spread her arms, spread her heart, showed me that pretty face♪
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: ♪And from that moment on, I found my dreams in her embrace♪
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: Is this song... about Helena?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Who else?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: If you ask me... the 'her' it mentions might not be a specific person, but rather a broader idea.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: What sort of idea?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Maybe this 'she' is a home filled with everyone's dreams. Davistown itself.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Hey, that makes sense!
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Think about it. The second verse talks about her 'body,' right? That's the energy tower. Her 'hair' is the white smoke coming from it, and her 'burning heart' must be the plant's furnace.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: And, in that section you fellas just sang, with her 'arms' and her 'embrace'? Ain't that just like those two long railroad tracks... embracing everyone here?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: So many pioneers carved out this piece of land, bit by bit, with the tools in their hands. It'd become the place they started their families and businesses in.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: And after that, even more youngsters arrived with their dreams and aspirations, following the footsteps of the previous generation and pitching in their youth and passion.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: 'She,' and only 'she,' is worthy of everyone's admiration.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: I knew it... I knew it!
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: It all makes sense now!
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Anyhow, no way in hell anybody's pinning all their hopes and dreams on my body.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: The engineer has nothing more to say. His eyelids droop and his head tilts back slightly, the restaurant owner's words whisking him back to the past.

attributes.text: He remembers the soot-stained faces of his coworkers when they went home after a long shift. He remembers how his neighbors would greet him in the morning when he left for work.
He remembers the cool and refreshing beer foam escaping from the rim of his glass, and the warmth on his cheeks from the children's kisses.
His thoughts are wild and turbulent, but they fill his heart with warmth and comfort.
Just like the song he is humming right now. Completely tuneless, yet moving nevertheless.

attributes.content: ♪And who's waiting at the end, who indeed but she♪
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: ♪She spread her arms, spread her heart, showed me that pretty face♪
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: ♪And from that moment on, I found my dreams in her embrace♪
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: The others in the room stop what they are doing, and make no other sounds. Only the engineer's voice is allowed to fill the entire restaurant.
After a while, the boiler worker's coarse voice joins the song, and the restaurant owner begins to hum along softly.
Even Woodrow, whose attention had been seized by the food on his plate, cannot help but tap his fingertips against his knees to the beat.
Only Jessica feels gripped by an inexplicable unease, as if there is a dark shadow in her heart that will not go away.
